etymology.description: 心(心) (xīn, "heart") + 壹(壹) (yī) = heart indicating virtuous character, 壹 as phonetic suggesting reverence
etymology.interpretation: The character 懿 combines the semantic component 心(心) (xīn, "heart"), suggesting moral and inner virtues, with the phonetic component 壹(壹) (yī), which adds the sound. Historically, the upper portion of 壹 depicted ceremonial offerings, enhancing the sense of moral excellence and reverence.
